sections.heading: What is 〜だろう/でしょう?
sections.content:
〜だろう (casual) and 〜でしょう (polite) express probability, conjecture, or predictions, meaning "probably," "I think," "likely," or "I suppose." They show the speaker's estimation about something.

明日は晴れるだろう "It will probably be sunny tomorrow" 彼は来るでしょう "He'll probably come" 難しいだろうね "It's probably difficult"

children.heading: Pattern: Plain form + だろう/でしょう
children.content:
With verbs:

行く → 行くだろう / 行くでしょう 来た → 来たでしょう 行かない → 行かないだろう

With い-adjectives:

高い → 高いだろう / 高いでしょう 良い → 良いでしょう 高くない → 高くないだろう

With な-adjectives:

便利 → 便利だろう / 便利でしょう 簡単 → 簡単でしょう

With nouns:

学生 → 学生だろう / 学生でしょう 雨 → 雨だろう / 雨でしょう

sections.heading: だろう vs でしょう

children.heading: だろう - Casual
children.content: 明日は雨だろう "It'll probably rain tomorrow" Use with friends, family More masculine

children.heading: でしょう - Polite
children.content: 明日は雨でしょう "It will probably rain tomorrow" Standard polite form Gender neutral

children.heading: でしょ - Very casual
children.content: 明日は雨でしょ "It'll probably rain tomorrow, right?" Super casual Rising intonation

children.heading: Making predictions
children.content: 明日は晴れるだろう "It will probably be sunny tomorrow" 彼は成功するでしょう "He will probably succeed" 試験は難しいだろう "The exam will probably be difficult"

children.heading: Expressing probability
children.content: たぶん来るだろう "He'll probably come" そうでしょう "That's probably so" 10時頃につくでしょう "We'll probably arrive around 10"

children.heading: Seeking agreement
children.content: いいでしょう？ "It's good, right?" そうでしょ？ "Right?" / "I told you so" 知ってるでしょう？ "You know, right?"

children.heading: Shows uncertainty
children.content: Less certain than はずだ More certain than かもしれない Moderate probability (60-80%) Speaker's estimation

children.heading: Can soften statements
children.content: Direct: 高い "It's expensive" Softened: 高いでしょう "It's probably expensive" Less assertive

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日、天気どうかな "I wonder about tomorrow's weather" B: たぶん晴れるでしょう "It'll probably be sunny" A: じゃあ、ピクニック行ける "Then we can go on a picnic"

children.heading: Example 2: Seeking Confirmation
children.content: A: これ、正しいでしょう？ "This is correct, right?" B: うん、そうだと思う "Yeah, I think so" A: よかった "Good"

children.heading: Example 3: Prediction
children.content: A: 彼、受かるかな "I wonder if he'll pass" B: 頑張ってたから、受かるでしょう "He was trying hard, so he'll probably pass" A: そうだといいね "I hope so"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Confusing with かもしれない
children.content: だろう: Probably (60-80% sure) 来るだろう "He'll probably come" かもしれない: Might (30-50% sure) 来るかもしれない "He might come" Different probability levels!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using です before だろう
children.content: Wrong: 学生ですだろう ❌ Right: 学生だろう ✓ Or: 学生でしょう ✓ Don't use です with だろう!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong intonation
children.content: でしょう↓ - Statement (probably) でしょう↑ - Question (right?) Intonation matters!

children.heading: Rising intonation (right?/isn't it?)
children.content: 知ってるでしょう？ "You know, right?" そうでしょう？ "Right?" / "See? I told you" 言ったでしょう？ "I told you, didn't I?" Seeking agreement

children.heading: Formal でしょう
children.content: 会議は3時に始まるでしょう "The meeting will probably start at 3" 彼は来ないでしょう "He probably won't come" それは難しいでしょう "That will probably be difficult"

children.heading: だっただろう/だったでしょう
children.content: 昨日は寒かっただろう "It was probably cold yesterday" 彼は知っていたでしょう "He probably knew" 大変だったでしょう "It was probably tough"

children.heading: ～ないだろう/でしょう
children.content: 来ないだろう "He probably won't come" 高くないでしょう "It probably isn't expensive" 簡単ではないだろう "It's probably not easy"

children.heading: Adding uncertainty
children.content: 誰が来るでしょうか "Who will come, I wonder?" いつ終わるだろう "When will it end, I wonder?" どうなるでしょう "What will happen?"

children.heading: Expressing doubt
children.content: 本当だろうか "I wonder if it's true" 彼は来るだろうか "I wonder if he'll come" うまくいくだろうか "I wonder if it will go well" Self-questioning

children.heading: たぶん～だろう/でしょう
children.content: たぶん来るでしょう "He'll probably come" たぶん大丈夫だろう "It's probably okay" Emphasizes probability

children.heading: きっと～だろう/でしょう
children.content: きっと成功するでしょう "He'll surely succeed" きっといい結果が出るだろう "We'll surely get good results" More certain than just だろう

children.heading: おそらく～だろう/でしょう
children.content: おそらく雨が降るでしょう "It will probably rain" おそらく来ないだろう "He probably won't come" Formal, written

children.heading: Very informal
children.content: そうでしょ！ "Right?!" / "See!" 知ってたでしょ "You knew, right?" いいでしょ "It's good, right?" With rising tone

children.heading: Making opinions less direct
children.content: Direct: 難しい "It's difficult" Softer: 難しいでしょう "It's probably difficult" Direct: 間違いだ "It's wrong" Softer: 間違いだろう "It's probably wrong"

children.heading: Business/Official
children.content: 結果は来週発表されるでしょう "The results will probably be announced next week" この提案は承認されるでしょう "This proposal will probably be approved" More formal tone

children.heading: 大変でしょう (That must be tough)
children.content: 忙しいでしょう "You must be busy" 疲れたでしょう "You must be tired" 大変でしょうね "That must be tough" Shows understanding

sections.heading: だろうと思う (I think probably)

children.heading: Combining patterns
children.content: 来るだろうと思う "I think he'll probably come" 成功するだろうと思います "I think it will probably succeed" Double probability marker

children.heading: でしょう？for emphasis
children.content: 誰だって知ってるでしょう？ "Everyone knows, right?" 当然でしょう？ "Of course, right?" 分かるでしょう？ "You understand, right?"

children.heading: From least to most certain
children.content: Least: かもしれない (might) ↓ だろう/でしょう (probably) ↓ と思う (I think) ↓ はずだ (should be) ↓ Most: にちがいない (must be)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 明日は晴れるでしょう "It will probably be sunny tomorrow" 彼は来ないだろう "He probably won't come" 難しいでしょうね "It's probably difficult"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: この映画は面白いでしょう。 みんなが褒めていましたから "This movie is probably interesting. Because everyone was praising it" 彼は今頃家に着いただろう "He's probably arrived home by now" そうでしょう？だから言ったのに "Right? That's why I told you"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 経済状況を考えると、今年の成長率は 低くなるでしょう。専門家も同じ意見です。 おそらく2%程度だろうと予想されています。 "Considering the economic situation, this year's growth rate will probably be low. Experts have the same opinion. It's predicted to be probably around 2%." 彼の経験と能力を考えれば、 このプロジェクトを成功させるでしょう。 困難はあるだろうが、必ず乗り越えられると 信じています。 "Considering his experience and ability, he will probably make this project succeed. There will probably be difficulties, but I believe he can definitely overcome them."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜かもしれない - Might (less certain) 〜はずだ - Should be (expected) 〜にちがいない - Must be (very certain) 〜と思う - I think だろうか - I wonder Probability expressions - Expressing likelihood
